snippet: New cars and trucks averaged a record 24.3 miles a gallon last year, but falling gas prices and sport utility vehicles could endanger future fuel economy gains.
abstract: Environmental  Protection Agency reports rise in average fuel economy in 2014 to record 24.3 miles a gallon, up 0.2 mpg from 2013; change is largely attributed to technical improvements, but resurgence of SUVs due to falling gas prices keeps gains modest.
lead_paragraph: New cars and trucks averaged a record 24.3 miles a gallon last year, but falling gas prices and sport utility vehicles could endanger future fuel economy gains.

headline.main: New Cars and Trucks Average a Record 24.3. M.P.G.
headline.print_headline: New Cars and Trucks Average a Record 24.3. M.P.G.
